author: news@vestikavkaza.ru (Vestnik Kavkaza)
title: Netanyahu: Israel ready for pause in fighting with Hamas
text: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he is ready for a cease in the fighting in the Gaza Strip in exchange for the release of hostages. "Israel has been, and still is, ready for a pause in the fighting in order to free our hostages. This is what we did when we freed 124 hostages, and resumed fighting - and this is what we are ready to do today as well," Benjamin Netanyahu said. The PM noted that Israel rejects the demands of the radical Palestinian movement [Hamas](https://en.vestikavkaza.ru/tags/Hamas) to withdraw Israeli forces from the Gaza Strip and will not accept a situation in which Hamas will reestablish control of the enclave. Netanyahu stressed that his government is doing its best to see the release of the hostages held in the enclave, maintaining that it is Palestinian radicals who are blocking the talks by making unacceptable demands. "But while Israel has shown this willingness, Hamas has still held to its extreme positions, first and foremost the withdrawal of our forces from the Strip, the conclusion of the war and leaving Hamas intact," Netanyahu said. The PM stressed that capitulating to Hamas's demands would be a terrible defeat for Israel and a great victory for Hamas and its allies.

author: Elisabeth Buchwald and Anna Bahney, CNN
title: Mortgage rates drop for the ninth week in a row | National | abc12.com
text: US mortgage rates continued to drop this week, which extends the good news for home buyers who have been facing the least affordable housing market since the 1980s. After dropping under 7% in early December for the first time since mid-August, rates fell again this week. The 30-year fixed-rate mortgage rate fell to an average of 6.61% in the week ending December 28, down from [6.67% the previous week,](https://www.cnn.com/2023/12/21/economy/mortgage-rates-drop-to-lowest-level-since-june/index.html) according to data from Freddie Mac released Thursday. A year ago, the average 30-year fixed-rate was 6.42%. It was the ninth-straight week of declines, dragged lower by the anticipation of [Federal Reserve rate cuts beginning next year](https://www.cnn.com/2023/12/19/business/fed-rate-cuts-2024/index.html). The average mortgage rate is based on mortgage applications that Freddie Mac receives from thousands of lenders across the country. The survey includes only borrowers who put 20% down and have excellent credit. A current buyer's rate [may be different.](https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/08/homes/mortgage-rate-averages/index.html) "The rapid descent of mortgage rates over the last two months stabilized a bit this week, but rates continue to trend down," Sam Khater, Freddie Mac's chief economist said in a statement on Thursday. However, [Realtor.com](http://Realtor.com) economist Jiayi Xu cautioned not to read too much into the latest mortgage rates, saying in a statement that it is "a general 'noisy' period during this time of year due to holiday-driven fluctuations." Looking ahead to 2024 Economists are expecting further declines in mortgage rates heading into 2024. Fed officials recently forecast a median of three rate cuts next year. If they happen, they'd likely put downward pressure on mortgage rates. While the central bank does not set the interest rates that borrowers pay on mortgages directly, its actions influence them. Mortgage rates track the yield on 10-year US Treasuries, which move up or down based on anticipation about the Fed's actions, the Fed's policy changes and investors' reactions to them. For the time being, the drop in mortgage rates "hasn't translated into a substantial sales recovery yet," Xu said. That's because a lack of housing inventory has helped prop up home prices. That said, Khater predicts "a nascent rebound in the housing market" in the coming year if inflation continues to decelerate. The-CNN-Wire â„¢ & Â© 2023 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Antonio Kozlow
title: MVP Joel Embiid isn't too impressed with Victor Wembanyama: 'Everything feels a little forced' - Basketball Insiders | NBA Rumors And Basketball News
text: [ NBA ](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/category/news/) MVP Joel Embiid isnâ€™t too impressed with Victor Wembanyama: â€˜Everything feels a little forcedâ€™ In the past couple of years, [Joel Embiid](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/nba/players/joel-embiid/) has grown into one of the NBAâ€™s most dominant big men. Not only was he awarded as the leagueâ€™s MVP last season, but two years prior, he was the runner-up to Nuggets star Nikola Jokic. Nowadays, the [Sixers](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/nba/teams/philadelphia-76ers/) center has the experience and accolades to form a worthy opinion on the league in general, but more specifically, on the development of young stars in the NBA. In a recent interview with The Athletic, the Philadelphia star shared his views on [Victor Wembanyama](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/nba/players/victor-wembanyama/). Like many first-pick selected rookies, they live with the pressure of sky-high expectations, and the French 19-year-old hasnâ€™t been the exception. Despite Joel considering him â€œextremely talented,â€ heâ€™s yet to be impressed by his role on the NBA courts. â€œI think, first of all, he has to figure out whether he wants to be a guard or a big or whatever. ğƒğ¨ ğ²ğ¨ğ® ğ°ğšğ§ğ­ ğ­ğ¨ ğ›ğğœğ¨ğ¦ğ ğŠğƒ, ğ¨ğ« ğğ¨ ğ²ğ¨ğ® ğ°ğšğ§ğ­ ğ­ğ¨ ğ›ğğœğ¨ğ¦ğ ğ¦ğ?â€ â€” Joel Embiid on Victor Wembanyama[via [https://t.co/AU8AbYMwcp]] [pic.twitter.com/HL3Yi2T3Ip] â€” BASKETBALL ON ğ• (@BasketballOnX) [December 28, 2023] â€œNot trying to be too critical. Obviously, extremely talented. Right now, thereâ€™s so much hype around him, I think heâ€™s trying to live up to the hype,â€ he started out. â€œThatâ€™s what I see. And I watch a lot of games. I think, first of all, he has to figure out where he wants to play, whether he wants to be a guard or a big or whatever.â€ According to Embiid, who said heâ€™s seen plenty of Wembyâ€™s games, he doesnâ€™t necessarily have to chose a single role, but he seems to be all over the place. â€œItâ€™s not necessarily whether he wants to be a guard or a big; itâ€™s what he wants to become. Do you want to become KD, or do you want to become me? Not KD, or like a version of those guys â€” you want to combine everything,â€ he said. â€œRight now, I just feel like everything kind of feels a little forced, in the way that heâ€™s playing. Which is not bad. Because the only way to get better is to play through it and learn. Thatâ€™s the only way. You make a lot of mistakes, and you learn,â€ the reigning MVP concluded. Wembanyama has already appeared in 26 of 29 of [San Antonio](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/nba/teams/san-antonio-spurs/)â€˜s matches this season, averaging 18.6 points, 10.6 rebounds, 3.0 blocks, and 2.8 assists per contest. Giannis Antetokounmpo also dedicated some advice for the rookie sensation, mostly referring to the importance of health Another NBA superstar decided to offer some advice for Wembanyama, who has impressed so far this season but isnâ€™t leading the race for Rookie of the Year. [Giannis Antetokounmpo](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/nba/players/giannis-antetokounmpo/) believes the youngster should emphasize on his mental and physical state. â€œTake care of his body. Very important. Being healthy. Because thereâ€™s a lot of games, a lot of practices, a lot of shootarounds,â€ said the [Bucks](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/nba/teams/milwaukee-bucks/) forward.â€Thereâ€™s going to be a lot of wear and tear. Take care of your body. Take care of your mental. Keep working on your game.â€ In the video above, check out some of Victorâ€™s most impressive plays during his first two months playing for the Spurs in the NBA. The Greek star added more counsel: â€œAnd if you do all of those things, and youâ€™re disciplined, things will go well. If you have a lot of talent, things will go well. Just (sought) out knowledge anywhere I can. Anywhere I can figure out things that can improve me as a person, as a basketball player.â€ - [Pistons vs. Celtics Odds, Picks, & Predictions (Dec. 28)](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/news/pistons-vs-celtics-odds-picks-predictions-dec-28/) - [MVP Joel Embiid isnâ€™t too impressed with Victor Wembanyama: â€˜Everything feels a little forcedâ€™](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/news/mvp-joel-embiid-isnt-too-impressed-with-victor-wembanyama-everything-feels-a-little-forced/) - [Pelicans, Smoothie King renew arena naming rights contract](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/news/pelicans-smoothie-king-renew-arena-naming-rights-contract/) - [NBA Lost Christmas Day Ratings Battle Against NFL For 4th Straight Year](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/news/nba-lost-christmas-day-ratings-battle-against-nfl-for-4th-straight-year/) - [Warriors forward Jonathan Kuminga disagrees with the amount of minutes heâ€™s received this season](https://www.basketballinsiders.com/news/warriors-forward-jonathan-kuminga-disagrees-with-the-amount-of-minutes-hes-received-this-season/) 1 day
